description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel gifted by Kaya. In this episode, it serves as the primary setting where the crew deals with their memory loss and confronts Drim.

keyEvents.title: Robin's Deduction
keyEvents.description: Robin deduces the pattern of memory loss aboard the Going Merry, determining that only sleeping crew members were affected.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the center of investigation into the memory mystery.

keyEvents.title: Crew Recalls the Mysterious Boy
keyEvents.description: The crew collectively remembers seeing the mysterious boy near their ship the previous night.
keyEvents.significance: The ship was the site of the initial memory theft incident.

keyEvents.title: Drim Appears on the Going Merry
keyEvents.description: Drim materializes on the ship's deck at night, bringing the confrontation directly to the crew.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the battleground for the crew's attempt to recover their memories.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Confronts Drim
keyEvents.description: Luffy attacks Drim on the deck of the Going Merry, demanding answers.
keyEvents.significance: The ship witnesses the first direct confrontation with the arc's antagonist.

keyEvents.title: Noko's Memory Restoration Effect
keyEvents.description: Aboard the Going Merry, Luffy's memories are partially restored through exposure to Noko's horn.
keyEvents.significance: The ship is where the solution to the memory crisis is first discovered.

statusHistory.reason: Ship is operational and serving as the crew's home during the Ocean's Dream Arc

description: Zoro's home village in the East Blue, location of the dojo where he trained as a child and made his promise to Kuina. Appears in flashback during this episode.

keyEvents.title: Flashback to Zoro's Promise
keyEvents.description: The episode flashes back to Shimotsuki Village where young Zoro made his promise to Kuina about becoming the world's greatest swordsman.
keyEvents.significance: The flashback reinforces the importance of this location in shaping Zoro's character and dreams.

statusHistory.reason: Village continues to exist and hold significance in Zoro's memories

description: The headquarters of the Arlong Pirates in the Conomi Islands, where Nami was forced to work as a cartographer. Appears in flashback during this episode showing Nami's traumatic past.

keyEvents.title: Flashback to Nami's Trauma
keyEvents.description: Nami experiences painful flashback memories of her suffering at Arlong Park, including the forced tattooing and her time under Arlong's control.
keyEvents.significance: The flashback emphasizes how deeply traumatic this location and these experiences were for Nami.

statusHistory.reason: Destroyed by Luffy during the battle to free Nami
